content.description: Sit start. From a low right ledge below the overhang, work your way left and up.Grade is a best estimate and likely quite height dependent.  I personally did not believe that any of the rocks directly below the starting hold are part of the same rock and chose to use the high pedestal out left as a starting foot. That said, the problem is not intended to be an eliminate and starting feet are up to your personal discretion.
content.location: Directly upstream of the Big Wobble and Jazz Boulder.

content.description: Sit start as per MOsemite but rather than trending directly up, round the corner and climb up the west face.

Starting up the flake/crack, climb directly up the tall and occasionally sharp face. The hardest moves come down low. PG13 is for the combination of height and condition: the problem is currently in a fairly uncleaned state, with moss, lichen, and some crumbly rock, although the rock up higher seems fairly stable. Holds could definitely pop, though, and I won't rule out larger blocks coming down too. Over time it should clean up alright. Please take it seriously for a V1, even if the technical difficulty isn't too high off the deck.
content.location: Near the downstream edge of the Scattershot area. Follow alongside the river until you reach a few sections of cliff. The Big Wobble faces the river.

content.description: The first boulders found on the way into River Left. The name of the area refers to the dispersed nature of these problems. Okay-sized boulders dot the hill, all easily visible when the brush drops its leaves. As you move further downriver, the density increases somewhat, with a small cluster of lines and a pseudo-cliff. Rock quality varies, but should improve with some traffic. There are some pretty proud lines to be had in this area, and plenty of less-proud-but-still-probably-fun ones. Be warned, though: getting here isn't trivial, especially in higher water, and the whole area is pretty well covered in brush (with not a few thorns!). Bring long pants, thick skin, or a willingness to go home with some scrapes.
